data.text: FIFA officials have paid tribute to Grant Wahl by placing flowers & a photo of him on the desk he would have used to cover England v France tonight. The US journalist, who turned 48 on Thursday, collapsed while reporting on Argentina v Netherlands last night and tragically died. https://t.co/AnADDkro4T

urls.title: Croatia vs Brazil live updates
urls.description: Hello and welcome to The Athletic's live match blog of Croatia vs Brazil in the quarter-finals of the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. Croatia will be hoping to replicate their 2018 performance and go all the way to the final, while Brazil are looking to win their first World Cup since 2002. Who will move one step closer to the final? Follow for live updates...Croatia: Livakovic, Juranovic, Lovren, Gvardiol, Sosa, Modric, Brozovic, Kovacic, Pasalic, Kramaric, Perisic. Brazil: Alisson, Eder Militao, Marquinhos, Thiago Silva, Danilo, Lucas Paqueta, Casemiro, Raphinha, Neymar, Vinicius Jr, Richarlison.World Cup quarter-final scheduleWorld Cup knockout bracketFIFA vs Brazil — why Pele goal numbers differ as Neymar closes in(Photo: Getty Images)

urls.title: Rice says World Cup rivals ‘should fear England’ ahead of France clash
urls.description: Declan Rice has said that other countries “should be starting to fear us now” ahead of England’s quarter-final against France on Saturday. England overcame a sluggish start to beat Senegal 3-0 on Sunday evening, with clinical finishes applied by Jordan Henderson, Harry Kane, and Bukayo Saka.

data.text: 🚨 Declan Rice on #ENG: “Don’t think we’ve been getting credit we deserve. Others win comfortably & called masterclasses. With us it always gets picked off. Last couple of games faultless. Countries should start to fear us now” @TheAthleticFC #FIFAWorldCup https://t.co/95ZszD9Ctc

urls.title: Sterling to leave World Cup after family home break-in
urls.description: Raheem Sterling is leaving the England World Cup squad in Qatar to return to England after armed intruders broke into his home on Saturday. It is believed his family were at home during the incident in Surrey. Sterling was understandably shaken by the news and decided to leave the tournament in...

data.text: 🚨 Raheem Sterling house in Surrey robbed by armed intruders last night. Family were in. Once alerted 27yo wanted to get home. May return to #FIFAWorldCup if right. Shaken & concerned for well-being of children. Commitment to #ENG unwavering @TheAthleticFC https://t.co/JSJal2ARcI
@FIVEUK And the England v Wales scoreline, as @Natpirks will attest 🔮🤓

Gakpo is emerging as one...

urls.title: De Ligt ‘did not expect’ to be starting for Netherlands at World Cup
urls.description: Bayern Munich defender Matthijs de Ligt has said he is “okay” with not starting for the Netherlands at the 2022 World Cup because he “expected to play nothing” under Louis van Gaal in Qatar. De Ligt, 23, started the Netherlands first match at the tournament — a 2-0 victory over Senegal —...

urls.description: Croatia defender Josko Gvardiol has spoken about speculation linking him to Chelsea.  The 20-year-old centre-back excelled during his country’s 0-0 draw with Belgium on Thursday afternoon, a result which sent his nation into the World Cup knockouts.  Asked about a potential move to Chelsea, the...

data.text: 🚨 Josko Gvardiol to @TheAthleticFC on Chelsea: “My agent is taking care of this & we’ll see. Right now I’m happy in Leipzig. #CFC a big club + maybe 1 day I’ll be there. Nice to see things like this, especially because there is Kovacic. So you never know” https://t.co/SGLIusdDmY

urls.title: Shaw motivated by memory of late grandmother at World Cup
urls.description: Luke Shaw has said the memory of his late grandmother is motivating him to play well at the 2022 World Cup after she passed away shortly before England’s opening match of the tournament. Manchester United full-back Shaw, 27, has started all three of England’s matches at the Qatar World Cup,...

data.text: Luke Shaw says memory of grandmother is inspiring him to succeed at #Qatar2022. Bereavement came on eve of 1st England game & #ENG boss Southgate offered 27yo time off. But #MUFC left-back says he has grieved + full focus is on #FIFAWorldCup @TheAthleticFC https://t.co/GEXkvAqfpm

urls.title: Wales vs England live updates
urls.description: Hello and welcome to The Athletic's live blog for Wales against England.Gareth Southgate's side need a point to qualify for the knockout stages but anything less than finishing top of Group B would fall below England supporters' expectations. Wales face a tall order to qualify but can qualify with a win if the US and Iran draw. Senegal await the winners of this group, while the Netherlands lie in store for the runners-up.The game kicks off at the Ahmad Bin Ali Stadium at 19:00 GMT, 14:00 EST and 11:00 PT — stay with us for live updates. Wales XI: Danny Ward, Neco Williams, Ben Davies, Chris Mepham, Joe Rodon, Joe Allen, Aaron Ramsey, Gareth Bale, Dan James, Ethan Ampadu, Kieffer Moore.England XI: Jordan Pickford, Kyle Walker, John Stones, Harry Maguire, Luke Shaw, Declan Rice, Jude Bellingham, Jordan Henderson, Harry Kane, Marcus Rashford, Phil Foden.Background readingWales vs England — line-ups and match statsWorld Cup permutationsKnockout stage: Who plays whom and when?World Cup stan

urls.description: Germany did not repeat their protest against FIFA’s ban of the ‘OneLove’ armband ahead of Sunday’s second group-stage match against Spain, with Ilkay Gundogan later saying: “The politics are finished”. The entire squad had covered their mouths in their team photo ahead of a...

urls.title: England vs USA live updates
urls.description: Hello and welcome to our live coverage of England vs the USMNT in the 2022 World Cup. England head into their second game of the World Cup a team revitalised after their morale-boosting 6-2 victory over Iran on Monday.Things are a little less rosy for the United States of America. They need to avoid defeat after their 1-1 draw with Wales and Gregg Berhalter acknowledged earlier this week that they will “have their work cut out for them” against England.The Group B clash kicks off at 22.00 local time which means it will start at 19.00 in the UK. The game will be shown on ITV.In the US, FOX and Telemundo will be showing the match and kick off is at 2pm ET and 11am PT.Join us as we bring you all the latest updates from the game.Background readingWorld Cup fixtures and resultsGroup B tactical guidesPulisic, pressing and more - where US vs England will be won and lostUSA vs England and the path towards respect and rivalryFootball vs Soccer - how different is the beautiful game?(Photo: Getty

urls.title: Live build-up to England vs the USMNT
urls.description: England take on the USMNT in the 2022 Qatar World Cup on Friday — and we will be bringing you live build-up to the Group B clash throughout the day.It promises to be a busy day in Qatar, with both managers set to meet with the media for their pre-match press conferences. Both sides will also invite journalists to watch the first few minutes of their training sessions, which could well provide us with some insight into Friday’s starting XIs.Both sides avoided defeat on Monday as they got their 2022 World Cup campaigns underway. England turned on the style as they thrashed Iran 6-2, while the USMNT were unlucky not to beat Wales, conceding late on to draw 1-1.England striker Harry Kane has been passed fit to face USMNT after previous fears over his ankle.Background readingTactical preview: USMNT will struggle if England midfield restrict PulisicAnalysing Harry Kane’s quiet efficiency: 19 touches, nine passes and two assistsIgnore flashier players – Mason Mount is undroppable for England

urls.title: World Cup 2022 live updates: Day four
urls.description: Welcome to our live coverage of the fourth day of the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.Today sees Germany play Japan and Spain take on Costa Rica in group E. And in group F, Morocco play Croatia in the early kick-off, before Belgium play Canada in the final match of the day.Tuesday saw Saudi Arabia stun Argentina in one of the biggest shocks in World Cup history. Stick with us for live news coverage throughout the day.Background reading World Cup fixtures and full scheduleWorld Cup group tactical guides: Group A | Group B | Group C | Group D | Group E | Group F | Group G | Group HYour guide to every team at Qatar 2022World Cup 2022 injuries: Who's out, who's doubtful?Why the Qatar World Cup is controversialPodcast: Qatar World Cup — how did we get here?Tifo Football: The Qatar World Cup explained(Photo: Getty Images)

urls.title: Harry Kane to have scan on ankle
urls.description: Harry Kane will have a scan on his ankle ahead of England’s next World Cup game against the U.S. The 29-year-old England captain appeared to be in pain after Morteza Pouraliganji brought him down with a lunging tackle five minutes into the second half on Monday. Kane managed to stay on the pitch...

data.text: 🚨 Harry Kane to have scan on right ankle. England captain took heavy blow on 48 mins of Iran win, went off in 75th + later seen with light strapping & slight limp. Indications were he was ok - #ENG will hope results clear @TheAthleticFC #FIFAWorldCup #USA https://t.co/ao5YHgJWSm

urls.title: Manchester United agree Cristiano Ronaldo exit

That work has developed rapidly and the 37-year-old’s...

urls.title: World Cup 2022 live updates
urls.description: Welcome to our live coverage of matchday 3 of the World Cup.Yesterday saw three matches, with England thrashing Iran 6-2. They took a lead in Group B after Wales and the United States drew. Netherlands beat Senegal 2-0 to draw level with Ecuador at the top of Group A.Todays games are:Argentina vs Saudi Arabia (10.00 GMT)Denmark vs Tunisia (13.00 GMT)Mexico vs Poland (16.00 GMT)France vs Australia (19.00 GMT)Stay tuned for live updates all day.Background reading World Cup fixtures and full scheduleWorld Cup group tactical guides: Group A | Group B | Group C | Group D | Group E | Group F | Group G | Group HYour guide to every team at Qatar 2022World Cup 2022 injuries: Who's out, who's doubtful?Why the Qatar World Cup is controversialPodcast: Qatar World Cup — how did we get here?Tifo Football: The Qatar World Cup explained(Photo: DIBYANGSHU SARKAR/AFP via Getty Images)

urls.title: Guardiola agrees new Man City deal
urls.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has agreed a two-year contract extension committing him to the club until 2025. The deal will be structured as an initial one-year deal, with both club and manager holding an option for a further season. That means either party could choose to end it sooner if...

urls.title: Harry Maguire substituted due to illness — Gareth Southgate
urls.description: Gareth Southgate has clarified Harry Maguire did not suffer a head injury during England’s win over Iran. The defender had to leave the pitch during the second half of the game on Monday. Maguire went down shortly after Mehdi Taremi got Iran’s first goal in their 6-2 loss, and appeared to be...

data.text: Harry Maguire substitution in England victory over Iran resulted from him feeling unwell + was not related to concussion. Asked afterwards if defender was ok & he said “should be”. #ENG next face #USA on Friday night @TheAthleticFC #FIFAWorldCup #Qatar2022 https://t.co/rXh8GCeJW6

urls.title: England routs Iran in World Cup opener: Full Highlights
urls.description: England dominated Iran 6-2 in their opening game of the 2022 World Cup.Jude Bellingham opened the scoring with a well-taken header before Bukayo Saka and Raheem Sterling extended England's lead in the first half.Saka scored a fourth for Gareth Southgate's side in the second half before Mehdi Taremi pulled one back for Iran. Marcus Rashford and Jack Grealish scored late in the second half to add gloss to the result for England, while Taremi managed a late consolation goal from the spot.For a deeper analysis of the game, click here.Background readingWorld Cup fixtures and full scheduleWorld Cup group tactical guides: Group A | Group B | Group C | Group D | Group E | Group F | Group G | Group HYour guide to every team at Qatar 2022World Cup 2022 injuries: Who's out, who's doubtful?(Photo: Getty Images)

tweets.text:
Trawl the internet & Yann Gueho almost ceases to exist.

He was in Chelsea's academy, Clairefontaine & rated more highly than Mbappe. But he's never played a professional game.

This is the story of his talent, prison spells & a belated diagnosis of bipolar disorder.

@stujames75

Mauricio Pochettino, the only man to have managed Harry Kane and Kylian Mbappe, on the two men who could decide England vs France on Saturday.

"Kane needs to be connected with the game. Kylian is the opposite. If he doesn't touch the ball, he’s relaxed."

#ENGFRA | #FIFAWorldCup

urls.title: Migrant worker died in accident on World Cup base during group stage
urls.description: Filipino man fell working on Saudi team base in incident that was covered up and highlights the continual concerns over working conditions

tweets.text:
An @TheAthleticFC investigation: 

A Filipino migrant worker died during the World Cup group stage at Saudi Arabia’s training resort in Qatar. He suffered a fatal blow to the head after a fall in a forklift accident.  

Read: https://t.co/eU08RNRJl3

Final day in Doha after boxing off the last 16 yesterday. 15 matches in 17 days, 8/8 stadiums done, no-idea-number of pieces written, 1 birthday, 0 rum & cokes drank and 1 billion memories made. Huge thanks to our team for their support, advice and fun. 

👋🏻🏆⚽️ #FIFAWorldCup https://t.co/yXA7dyCWfd

What format makes most sense?
Are they listening to suggestions?

urls.description: Flick's gung-ho tactics backfired but there is a clear imbalance of talent between positions. Germany don't need a reboot, just an update

urls.title: Shaw motivated by memory of late grandmother at World Cup
urls.description: Luke Shaw has said the memory of his late grandmother is motivating him to play well at the 2022 World Cup after she passed away shortly before England’s opening match of the tournament. Manchester United full-back Shaw, 27, has started all three of England’s matches at the Qatar World Cup,...

tweets.text: Luke Shaw says memory of grandmother is inspiring him to succeed at #Qatar2022. Bereavement came on eve of 1st England game & #ENG boss Southgate offered 27yo time off. But #MUFC left-back says he has grieved + full focus is on #FIFAWorldCup @TheAthleticFC https://t.co/GEXkvAqfpm

Female Iranian fans believe they're being watched at games by 'spotters' from their government.

The women - who aren't allowed at matches back home - saw men filming them & others watching with binoculars.

The concerns have been reported to FIFA.

@AdamCrafton_ @lmwilliamson7

urls.description: Rangers are closing in on the appointment of Michael Beale as their new manager after a deal was agreed with QPR. urls.title: Liverpool sporting director Ward to step down at end of the season
urls.description: Liverpool sporting director Julian Ward will step down at the end of the season. The 41-year-old only took over from Michael Edwards last summer but he has informed the club’s owners that he intends to take a break from football. He will remain in the role until May as Liverpool consider how best...

Lionel Messi has a lucrative deal to promote Saudi Arabia.

The Saudis want the 2030 World Cup, as do Messi's Argentina.

urls.title: England World Cup squad: Live updates
urls.description: Gareth Southgate has named his final 26-man squad for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.Goalkeepers: Jordan Pickford, Nick Pope, Aaron Ramsdale.Defenders: Trent Alexander-Arnold, Conor Coady, Eric Dier, Harry Maguire, Luke Shaw, John Stones, Kieran Trippier, Kyle Walker, Ben White.Midfielders: Jude Bellingham, Conor Gallagher, Jordan Henderson, Mason Mount, Kalvin Phillips, Declan Rice.Forwards: Phil Foden, Jack Grealish, Harry Kane, James Maddison, Marcus Rashford, Bukayo Saka, Raheem Sterling, Callum Wilson.Follow all of the latest reaction below.The full list of England World Cup jersey numbers has been released.
